name: Select
description: Select components allow users to choose a single value from a list of options. They're useful when space is limited and the list of options is predictable.

overview.purpose: Selects provide a compact way to present a list of options. They're ideal when the user needs to choose from a predefined set of values.
principles: Use select when there are more than 5-7 options
Order options logically (alphabetical, by frequency, or by importance)
Provide a clear default or placeholder when appropriate
Consider searchable select for long lists (10+ options)

whenToUse: When space is limited and a list would be too long
Selecting a single value from a closed set
Form fields like country, state, or category selection
whenNotToUse: For 2-4 options - use Radio buttons instead
For binary choices - use Checkbox or Toggle
When users might need to enter custom values - use Combobox
For multi-select - use MultiSelect or Checkbox group

anatomy.description: A select consists of a trigger button and a dropdown list of options.

parts.name: Label
parts.description: Describes what selection is being made

parts.name: Trigger
parts.description: Button that opens the dropdown and shows current selection

parts.name: Dropdown
parts.description: Container for the list of options

parts.name: Option
parts.description: Individual selectable item in the list

variants.name: Default
variants.description: Standard select with border and background

variants.name: Native
variants.description: Uses native browser select for maximum accessibility

states.name: Default
states.description: Resting state with placeholder or value

accessibility.description: Select must be keyboard navigable and properly labeled.

guidelines.title: Keyboard Navigation
guidelines.description: Arrow keys to navigate, Enter to select, Escape to close

guidelines.title: Labels
guidelines.description: Always associate label with select using htmlFor

guidelines.title: ARIA
guidelines.description: Use proper ARIA attributes for custom selects

do: Provide a sensible default when appropriate
Consider native select for simple use cases
dont: Don't use select for less than 5 options
Don't use placeholder as the label
